page.title: 11THE TOLL HOUSE
page.content: In the past the government wanted the roads improving. They wanted to build new roads because the roads were bumpy and not safe. On a{toll {road}the people had to pay to go where they were going. On our map we have an old{toll {house.} The toll house on our map is out of use today. Someone lives in the house now and the toll road is not private anymore. Now you can go across without paying anything. It was called the{Brampton Bierlow {and Hooton Roberts Trust}and the toll house was put up at the end of the road to make sure that every traveller paid. The trust also repaired stretches of road and charged travellers a fee for using them. The toll house was still in use in 1854 but not today.
